Albany.Hurstville, New York: Hurstville is a former hamlet in the town of Bethlehem, New York. Today it is part of the city of Albany. Hurstville was located in a bend of the Albany, Rensselaerville, and Schoharie Turnpike (today New Scotland Avenue) at the intersections with Whitehall and Krumkill roads; just outside the city limits of Albany.
